game.material.board

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.material.board.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    A grid with contents to be used on a Go game board. Created by erik.huizinga on 23-1-17.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int dim
      The square playable grid single-side dimension.
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,GameMaterial> grid
      The full grid, a Map of Integer linear indices with GameMaterials.

      The map of linear indices to subscript indices.
      private int maxNumSpaces
      The maximum number of spaces around an element for padding in the toString method.
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> neighborsMap
      The neighbour map, containing the linear indices to the four neighbours as value to the linear index keys.
      static java.lang.String SPACE
      The space character used by Grid in the toString method.
      private java.util.Map<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>,java.lang.Integer> sub2IndMap
      The map of subscript indices (Arrays.asList(x, y)) to linear indices (horizontally incremental from the top left to bottom right), with x horizontally incremental from the left and y vertically incremental from the top.

    • Field Detail

      • sub2IndMap

        private final java.util.Map<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>,java.lang.Integer> sub2IndMap
        The map of subscript indices (Arrays.asList(x, y)) to linear indices (horizontally incremental from the top left to bottom right), with x horizontally incremental from the left and y vertically incremental from the top. All indices range from 0 to the playable grid dimension plus two (see Grid).

      • ind2SubMap

        private final java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> ind2SubMap
        The map of linear indices to subscript indices.

      • grid

        private final java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,GameMaterial> grid
        The full grid, a Map of Integer linear indices with GameMaterials.

      • neighborsMap

        private final java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> neighborsMap
        The neighbour map, containing the linear indices to the four neighbours as value to the linear index keys.

      • dim

        private final int dim
        The square playable grid single-side dimension.

      • maxNumSpaces

        private final int maxNumSpaces
        The maximum number of spaces around an element for padding in the toString method.

      • SPACE

        public static final java.lang.String SPACE
        The space character used by Grid in the toString method.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid(int dim)
        Construct a square Grid with single-side dimensions as specified. The grid contains the playable part of the game board, initialised as BoardFeature.EMPTY, as well as the surrounding sides, initialised as BoardFeature.SIDE. Therefore, the playable grid has the dimension as specified, but with the boundaries included the full grid single-side dimension is the playable single-side dimension plus two.
        Parameters:
        dim - the playable grid single-side dimension.

      • Grid

        public Grid(Grid grid)
        Instantiate a new Grid as a copy of another.
        Parameters:
        grid - the grid to copy.

      • init

        private void init()
        Initialise the Grid by setting the material of the playable grid to BoardFeature.EMPTY, the material of the boundaries to BoardFeature.SIDE and initialise the sub2Ind and ind2Sub methods.

      • isBoundary

        private boolean isBoundary(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> sub)
        Determine if the specified subscript indices point to a boundary of the full grid, i.e., outside the playable grid.
        Parameters:
        sub - the subscript indices.
        Returns:
        true if on a boundary; false otherwise.
